items.title: SonyLIV Chief Danish Khan to Exit Sony Pictures Networks India
items.summary: Danish Khan, business head of streaming platform SonyLIV and production unit Studio NXT, will depart Sony Pictures Networks India at the end of March 2026 after a decade in his current tenure with the company. Khan will remain in his role through March 31 to ensure business continuity, SPNI revealeâ€¦

The transaction includes new, undisclosed funding from ReBirth aâ€¦

items.title: vivo Y50e and Y50s are on the way, new vivo device gets certified with 44W charging support

items.title: 'This is ridiculous!' - Smith dismissed after more Snicko controversy
items.summary: Confusion reigns on day two of the third Ashes Test with England's Jamie Smith at the centre of the controversy after he's given not out after review, only to be given out moments later in a separate delivery, due to a contentious use of the Snicko technology.

items.title: Weekly sports quiz: Who won Fifa's Puskas Award?
items.summary: How much attention have you paid to what's happened in the world of sport during the past seven days?

items.title: Watch trailer for Sir Chris Hoy: Cancer, Courage & Me
items.summary: Sir Chris Hoy opens up about his journey with terminal cancer and how the mental strength he honed as a six-time Olympic gold medallist is helping him inspire others.

items.title: Why are Premier League shirts so expensive?

items.title: Chequered Flag Season Review
items.summary: Harry Benjamin and the team look back on the 2025 F1 season from McLarenâ€™s HQ.

items.title: Xiaomi 17 Ultra's launch timeframe officially confirmed
items.summary: A recent rumor claimed that Xiaomi would launch the Xiaomi 17 Ultra on December 26 in China. Well, that rumor has partly proven true. We say this because Xiaomi has confirmed that the Xiaomi 17 Ultra is coming next week without confirming the date. The Chinese brand also confirmed its collaborationâ€¦

items.title: The ChatGPT app store is here
items.summary: On Wednesday evening, OpenAI launched an App Directory to browse all the tools currently available and opened its SDK for developers to build new interactive experiences that operate within the bot's UI. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said last month that "We are planning to build the obvious features that â€¦

The first trailer for â€œIn the Hands of the Fans,â€ the upcoming season featuring some of the best to ever play the game, debuted on Wednesday night followâ€¦

items.title: In Show of Force, Netflix Chiefs Visit Warner Bros. Lot Amid Battle With Paramount for Studioâ€™s Future
items.summary: As the future of the studio hangs in the balance, Warner Bros. Discovery and Netflix leaders put on a show of force Wednesday afternoon when Netflix brass paid a visit to the Warner Bros. lot in Burbank, where WBD chief executive David Zaslav gave them a guided tour. WBD released photos to media ouâ€¦

items.title: Sony’s legal battle against Tencent’s Horizon â€˜cloneâ€™ is already over
items.summary: In July, Sony sued Tencent to prevent the release of Light of Motiram, a game Sony alleged was a "slavish clone" of its popular Horizon series. But the legal battle is already over; the two companies have reached a "confidential settlement" and the case has been dismissed with prejudice, according â€¦

items.title: More Poco M8 Pro details leak, it seems to be a rebranded Redmi
items.summary: Poco is once again rumored to unveil the M8 Pro in January, and today a new rumor from a tipster over on X claims to shed more light on what we should expect from the device. According to this source, the Poco M8 Pro will be identical to the upcoming Redmi Note 15 Pro+ in every way bar one. The keyâ€¦

items.title: 'Give Australia the urn' - England in trouble as Cummins removes Root
items.summary: Pat Cummins takes his second wicket of the innings as Joe Root is caught behind for 19 as England fall to 71-4 in their first innings, 300 runs behind Australia's 371, as the home side take control on day two of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

items.title: 'A little fairytale' - Lyon overtakes McGrath in Test wicket-taker list
items.summary: The Australia spinner now sits sixth on the all-time list with 564 wickets after removing Ollie Pope and Ben Duckett in the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

items.title: 'England are crumbling' - Lyon removes Pope and Duckett in same over
items.summary: In his first over of the match, Nathan Lyon removes Ollie Pope and Ben Duckett as England fall to 42-3, in pursuit of Australia's 371, on day two of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

items.title: Joshua doubles down on vulgar 'kill' comments to Paul
items.summary: Anthony Joshua doubles down on his controversial "kill" comments to Jake Paul after being challenged at a news conference in Miami.

items.title: Google launches faster Gemini 3 Flash, now available in the Gemini app and Google Search
items.summary: After the introduction of Gemini 3 Pro last month, today Google has unveiled Gemini 3 Flash. This is the faster model, as its name implies. It's built from the ground up for speed, in fact Google says it feels as fast as a Google search for most prompts. Gemini 3 Flash is now the default model in tâ€¦

items.title: LG and Dolby partner to release the first FlexConnect soundbar
items.summary: Dolby Atmos FlexConnect technology debuted this year with the TCL Z100 speakers, and now we're getting our first FlexConnect soundbar thanks to LG. The new H7 soundbar - which runs on the same Alpha 11 Gen 3 chip as LG's OLEDs and new Micro RGB LED - is a part of the LG Sound Suite, a modular home â€¦

items.title: 'Questions pile up at Celtic, but only some are for Nancy'
items.summary: At this point, it's not just Wilfried Nancy's Celtic team that's a hard watch, it's Nancy himself, writes Tom English.

items.title: Archer finishes with five wickets as Australia bowled out for 371
items.summary: Jofra Archer removes Mitchell Starc and Nathan Lyon on the morning of day two to finish with figures of 5-53, earning his fourth career Test five-wicket haul as England bowl Australia out for 371 in their first innings of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

items.title: 'Can be as good as anyone' - Miley steps up for Newcastle
items.summary: Lewis Miley "can be as good as anyone in his position, whichever position he plays", says Newcastle boss Eddie Howe after the teenage midfielder becomes a match-winning right-back against Fulham.

items.title: 'Keep the faith' urges Celtic boss Nancy after fourth defeat
items.summary: Celtic manager Wilfried Nancy insists his side "did a good job" despite suffering a fourth defeat in a row at Dundee United.

items.title: Watch Celtic lose fourth game in row at Dundee Utd
items.summary: Watch the best of the action as Celtic throw away a lead to lose 2-1 at Dundee United for a fourth defeat in a row.

With Quick Cut, you can select multiple photos or clips and then "instantly preview a rendered video," and the featuâ€¦

items.title: The 44 best gift ideas for mom this holiday season
items.summary: Your mom deserves the best, and we're going to help you get them something special. The right gift can make family or friend time more valuable, after all, or it can greatly enrich time spent alone. If your mom says that she has all that she needs, don't take her word for it and show up empty-handeâ€¦

items.title: Is Nancy in danger after 14 days at Celtic?
items.summary: Four games, four defeats and the fans already turning against him - where do Celtic and Wilfried Nancy go from here?

items.title: 'When fans turn, that's the end. I don't think we're far away from that'

items.summary: Chelsea, Arsenal and Manchester United remain in the hunt for Women's Champions League glory - but how are they set for the knockout stages?

items.title: Newcastle to face Man City in EFL Cup semi-finals
items.summary: Holders Newcastle United face eight-time winners Manchester City in the semi-finals of the Carabao Cup while Chelsea take on Arsenal or Crystal Palace.

items.title: Apple releases the first public betas of iOS 26.3 and iPadOS 26.3
items.summary: Following the developer-focused release which came out yesterday, today Apple has made the first public betas of iOS 26.3 and iPadOS 26.3 available to those who are part of its beta program. With iOS 26.3 you get an easier way to transfer your data to an Android device if you're switching to that. â€¦

items.title: Roma's Zirkzee deal deadlock - Thursday's gossip
items.summary: Manchester United and Roma deadlocked over Joshua Zirkzee, Barcelona eye Aston Villa's Pau Torres, Crystal Palace want Sacha Boey and AC Milan in talks with West Ham over Niclas Fullkrug.

items.title: Wade cruises through but Van Barneveld knocked out
items.summary: James Wade wins his opening match at the PDC World Darts Championship, but 2007 winner Raymond van Barneveld is knocked out.

items.title: 'He cannot play left-back' - should Trafford 'stick it out' at Man City?
items.summary: James Trafford is up against one of the best in the world in Gianluigi Donnarumma, but should he stick it out as number two at Manchester City?

items.title: Dickens' world title defence against Tsutsumi off

items.title: Samsung Galaxy Z TriFold sells out again in Korea, laughably small stock to blame
items.summary: One way to drive hype about a new product is to supply way less of it than is demanded, and then wait for all the "sold out" headlines to appear. This seems to be exactly what Samsung is doing in Korea with the Galaxy Z TriFold, which already sold out once, in mere minutes, when it first went on saâ€¦

items.title: Nearly 7,000 of the worldâ€™s 8,808 data centers are built in the wrong climate, analysis find â€” vast majority located outside optimal temperature range for cooling, 600 in locations considered too hot
items.summary: Nearly 7,000 of the worldâ€™s operational data centers are located in climates that fall outside the temperature range recommended for efficient operation, according to a new analysis.

items.title: Watch the OnePlus 15R and OnePlus Pad Go 2's launch event here
items.summary: OnePlus will unveil the OnePlus 15R and OnePlus Pad Go 2 today during an event starting at 1:30 PM UTC. It will be streamed live on YouTube, and you can follow it with us by tuning in to the stream below. OnePlus is advertising the 15R as the "ultimate value flagship device." The company hasn't detâ€¦

items.title: Enthusiast modder stuffs an entire gaming PC inside a gutted Commodore PET 2001 â€” replaced the screen with an iPad Retina LCD, but the original keyboard still works
items.summary: A Redditor found a "pre-gutted" Commodore PET 2001 that they repurposed as a fully-fledged gaming PC, while keeping the Commodore's keyboard intact and functional. The internals are relatively modest, but they can still play most modern games on the retrofitted screen, which is a Retina LCD from anâ€¦

items.title: New calculator helps evaluate the economics of datacenters in space â€” running the numbers on orbital computing reveals a brutal reality
items.summary: Orbital data centers have been proposed as a way around the power, cooling, and regulatory requirements of building on Earth, but new analysis reveals that the costs of deploying such installations would be astronomical.

items.title: Devastated PC builder orders DDR5 RAM from Amazon, receives DDR2 and some weights â€” counterfeit 32GB kit a worrying sign of rising return and sales fraud
items.summary: A buyer in Spain has reported receiving a sealed DDR5 memory kit that contained counterfeit parts, raising fresh concerns about return fraud affecting high-value PC components.

items.title: Who could challenge Sinner and Alcaraz in 2026?
items.summary: After Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner swept the Grand Slams again, BBC Sport analyses who might stop them in 2026 - and you can have your say.

items.title: Carey scores century but third Test in the balance after day one
items.summary: Alex Carey hit 106 off 143 balls to help Australia recover from 94-4 to 326-8 at stumps on the opening day of the third Ashes Test against England in Adelaide, in a must-win match for Ben Stokes' side if they're to keep the series alive.

items.title: Joshua not worried about 'integrity' of Paul fight
items.summary: Anthony Joshua says he is more focused on the interest his fight with Jake Paul garners than the integrity of the bout.

items.title: AJ needs a dance class before trying to box - Paul
items.summary: Jake Paul claims to be a "better boxer" than Anthony Joshua in his pre-fight media conference.

items.title: Henry to be honoured with Lifetime Achievement award
items.summary: Thierry Henry will be honoured with the Lifetime Achievement award at BBC Sports Personality of the Year on Thursday.

items.title: 'A super knock' - Carey scores century to help Australia past 300
items.summary: Alex Carey stars for Australia on the opening day of the third Ashes Test, scoring 106, his third career Test century, and his first against England, to help Australia recover from 94-4 to 307-7 at stumps in Adelaide.

items.title: No script, Joshua will quickly knock Paul out - Hearn
items.summary: Eddie Hearn has been hearing people back Jake Paul against Anthony Joshua and wonders if he is losing his mind.

items.title: Jacks strikes to deny Khawaja century
items.summary: Will Jacks removes Usman Khawaja for 82, with the batter caught by Josh Tongue in the deep, leaving Australia 185-5 on day one of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

items.title: Two wickets in three balls as Archer removes Labuschagne and Green
items.summary: England's Jofra Archer gets two wickets in three balls, removing Marnus Labuschagne and Cameron Green in the first over after lunch as Australia fall to 94-4 on day one of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

items.title: 'What a stunner' - Crawley takes brilliant catch to remove Head
items.summary: England's Zak Crawley produces a brilliant one-handed catch to remove Travis Head for 10 as Australia fall to 33-2 on day one of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

items.title: Arctic launches its best thermal paste yet for chips of all types â€” claims new MX-7 formulation runs 3% cooler than its predecessor
items.summary: Arctic has launched the MX-7 thermal paste, the successor to the all-popular MX-6.

items.title: New 1.4nm nanoimprint lithography template could reduce the need for EUV steps in advanced process nodes â€” questions linger as no foundry has yet committed to nanoimprint lithography for high-volume manufacturing
items.summary: Japanâ€™s Dai Nippon Printing (DNP) claims to have developed a nanoimprint lithography template capable of patterning logic with a feature size of 1.4nm, with plans for mass production in 2027.

items.title: With a standout $1739.99 price tag, this packed CyberPower PC features both the Ryzen 7 9800X3D and Radeon RX 9070 XT for an amazing prebuilt gaming setup â€” beat the AI crunch with 32GB of DDR5 and a 2TB NVMe SSD
items.summary: This 9800X3D-infused CyberPower gaming PC also packs a Radeon RX 9070 XT for ultimate gaming performance.

items.title: Elizabeth Warren, other U.S. senators concerned about big tech pushing up electricity costs â€” demands explanation from Amazon, Google, Meta as AI data centers drive up residential energy bills
items.summary: Three Democratic Senators are investigating the impact of the massive AI data center build out on the electricity bill of the average American.

items.title: Boy breaks 50 of his father's Samsung M.2 NVMe SSDs worth nearly $4,000 â€” 25,600 GB of storage ruined by ten-year-old oblivious to global NAND crisis
items.summary: Tragic images showing 50 mangled M.2 SSDs has been shared on social media. It looks like a naughty boy was the culprit.

items.title: Don't wait if you're planning to upgrade your RAM or SSD, Kingston rep warns â€” says 'prices will continue to go up,' NAND costs up 246%
items.summary: Kingston Datacenter SSD Business Manager Cameron Crandall said in an interview that NAND prices for RAM and SSD are expected to rise throughout 2026.

items.title: In Pictures: Sporting photos of the week
items.summary: A selection of some of the most striking sports photographs taken around the world over the past seven days.

items.title: Sapphire rep predicts DRAM prices will begin to stabilize in the next 6-8 months, but warns 'it may not be the prices we want' â€” GPU vendor says memory crisis is similar to tariff uncertainty
items.summary: Amidst the economic uncertainty ushered in by this AI boom, some folks still have conviction and are offering hope to the community. Edward Crisler, the PR manager for GPU maker Sapphire, has just said that he believes DRAM prices will start to plateau in the next few months, so don't panic buy rigâ€¦

items.title: Qualcommâ€™s Ventana acquisition points to a long-term RISC-V strategy to complement its Arm lineup
items.summary: Qualcomm has agreed to acquire Ventana Micro Systems, a RISC-V CPU specialist whose engineers have spent several years pushing the open instruction set toward high-performance server and edge designs.

items.title: Last Minute 3D Printers for Kids, Teens, and Beginners - these models are available now and will arrive in time for Christmas
items.summary: Here are the best deals on kid and beginner-friendly 3D printers, available in US warehouses for fast shipping to your door.

items.title: AI-designed Linux computer with 843 components boots on first attempt â€” dual-PCB Project Speedrun was made in just one week and required less than 40 hours of human work
items.summary: LA-based startup Quilter has outlined Project Speedrun, which marks a milestone in computer design by AI.

items.title: The data center cooling state of play (2025) â€” Liquid cooling is on the rise, thermal density demands skyrocket in AI data centers, and TSMC leads with direct-to-silicon solutions
items.summary: The rise of AI and hyperscale computing is driving a global shift from air-based to liquid and embedded cooling as various companies are developing silicon-integrated systems capable of handling multi-kilowatt system-in-packages that can be commercialized by 2027.

items.title: Roomba maker iRobot announces bankruptcy â€” brand will live on under ownership of former supplier
items.summary: Roomba maker iRobot goes bankrupt; now owned by former supplier Picea

items.title: Innovation, evolution, revolution - golf's new faces championing change
items.summary: With an influx of new people at the head of the sport's most important bodies, the groundwork is being laid for rapid change, writes Iain Carter.

items.title: HKC announces world's first RGB Mini LED monitor â€” M10 Ultra will have 4,788 addressable full-color backlight zones
items.summary: HKC has announced its M10 Ultra, a new monitor from China that will be the world's first RGB Mini LED panel in a monitor. RGB Mini LED screens put a sea of addressable RGB backlights behind their panels, reaching the best color accuracy that any screen has ever seen.

items.title: Sapphire PR manager wishes AMD and Nvidia would let partners run wild with design â€” wants freedom to bring back Toxic line more often
items.summary: PR manager at Sapphire, Edward Crisler told Hardware Unboxed in a podcast that he wishes chip makers (like AMD and Nvidia) would let AIB partners roam free and build creative graphics card designs without restrictions.

items.title: Asus swaps out the PCIe x16 connector for x8 on new RTX 5060 Ti GPUs â€” Gigabyte does the opposite with x16 upgrade to its WindForce Max card
items.summary: Asus and Gigabyte have released revised versions of the companies' GeForce RTX 5060 Ti graphics cards, powered by Nvidia's Blackwell architecture.

items.title: The 'ExtrudeX' machine wants to turn your 3D printing waste into reusable filament, all at home â€” this Kickstarter project is itself 3D-printable with minimal hardware costs
items.summary: Your 3D printing costs are about to go way down with the ExtrudeX, an extrusion machine claiming to recycle 3D printing waste into new filament. The project is live on Kickstarter, and should you choose to pledge it, you'll get STL files to 3D print the machine at home yourself, along with a list oâ€¦

items.title: HDD prices spike as AI infrastructure and China's PC push collide â€” hard drives record biggest price increase in eight quarters, suppliers warn pressure will continue
